topic.title: Zeronet realt time messaging
topic.body:
Dear all,
I am a beginner with zeronet. 
I want to use Zeronet for my personal project in which i want to send messages realt time after every half of second. Can you please tell me if this is possible with ZeroNet?

topic.title: synchronize the database every half of second?
topic.body:
Hi everyone,
I am using PeerMessage plugin to send and receive messages almost real time, like every half of second.
I want to know if it is possible to synchronize the database on realtime? like signing and publishing every half of second?

1555954035_1gyp68xGQMYy4CBjedTvYU6xsyxPv.body:
> [glightstar](#comment_110_14K7EydgyeP84L1NKaAHBZTPQCev8BbqCy): It is possible by utilizing the PeerMessage plugin (github) developed by @gitcenter, @krixano and @thunder33345. For the best performance, I suggest you use the new python3 version of ZeroNet together with the python3 version of just-mentioned plugin, which can both be found in the py3-branches of the respective repositories.

Thank you very much for the reply.
Can you please tell me how to use this pluging, there is a little guide but i could't understand properly: I have to pull the plugin and where i have to place it? in the source folders of ZeroNet i found a plugin folder, so should i pull the PeerMessage plugin there?

> [lavaphox](#comment_19_13SFxfKtzbvyUWADdNZs3oKh1YSJwmohWm): i know that im developing one, buuut idk when its done since im super lazy right now :P

Are you working on git? Can you please share the project so i can get an idea?

@glightstar @lavaphox,
Thank you very much for the reply.
I used Peermessage and i am able to send and receive messages, almost real time. 
But i have another question: is it possible to synchronize the built in database in real time? like signing and publishing after every half second?

> [glightstar](#comment_146_14K7EydgyeP84L1NKaAHBZTPQCev8BbqCy): Publishing to the network is limited to one action per 30 seconds by the ZeroNet client.I'm not quite sure if @lavaphox understood your question right, or if I might be understanding it wrong tho.. [...]

I think you understood it right, i want to publish it to the network almost realtime. If i put it simple, i want to synchronize the database of the peers (nodes) every half of second
